title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861 :
author: Victoria
snippet: The Duchess told us there were many of thesecaves all along the river to Rosslyn. We came home through Bonnyrigg, anothercollier village, and through Dalkeith. Thursday, September 15.

title: Trainspotting
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: It was her Auntie Cathy and Uncle Davie. They had made good time from Leith out to Bonnyrigg.

title: Skagboys
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: We baith notice that Fiona and slimy Geoff fae Bonnyrigg areapproaching. If that cunt's been chattin her up . . .

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: The Duchess told us there were many of thesecaves aU along the river to Rosslyn. We came home through Bonnyrigg, anothercollier vUlage, and through Dalkeith.

title: Leaves from the journal of our life in the Highlands, from 1848 to 1861.
author: Victoria
snippet: We came home through Bonnyrigg, another collier village, and through Dalkeith.

title: Trainspotting
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: The by-pass makes a difference. Pick it up just ootside Portobellah, git off jist before Bonnyrigg, Davie explained dutifully.

title: Trainspotting
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: Her Auntie Cathy and Uncle Davie (he was from Glasgow and a Protestant), had two sons: Billy, who had just come out of the army, and Mark, who was supposed to be into drugs. They were not here, as they hardly knew Andy or any of the Bonnyrigg crowd. They would probably be at the funeral.

title: The Story of My Life, volumes 4-6
author: Hare, Augustus J. C. (Augustus John Cuthbert)

title: The Story of My Life, volumes 4-6
